summary: Officially Jonsas are damn CRUEL, DEVIL, Unhealthy, DEMON peoples who dreaming death of Dany because of marriage Jon and Sansa....
body:
Officially Jonsas are damn CRUEL, DEVIL, Unhealthy, DEMON peoples who dreaming death of Dany because of marriage Jon and Sansa. This people will never be a mental healthy . They are absolutely disrespectful people.

They are dreaming how Dany will die with childbirth and her baby stays alone without mother. And Jonerys baby grow up without family like Jon and Dany.

They wanted Jonerys baby and Sansa like Catelyn and Jon

Dany isn’t dark. Neither cruel.

Jonsa fans are really cruel and devil people.

How much sick can be people who dreaming about death of woman ? Because their delusionas be real? (It’s never be real)

This people are devil! This people are sick!

summary: The Starks will be unstoppable in season 8.
title: The Starks will be unstoppable in season 8.
body:
The show started out rough for the Stark’s but season 8 will be their season. We have the magical three-eyed raven, a skilled master assassin, a potential young queen who is kind and fast becoming a master of the Game and Jon Snow a skilled warrior who just so happens to be the heir to the Iron Throne. They have the allegiance of the North and Vale and loyal support from from the likes of Sam, Brienne and soon Jaime. It’s true that anything could happen, but House of Stark has been through a lot and are likely to come out stronger than ever this final season.

I am sooo excited you guys and can not wait !!!!

summary:
Jon found Dany’s scarf inside his chamber. Last time they were inside his chamber. They made love together.
He didn’t see her...
body:
Jon found Dany’s scarf inside his chamber. Last time they were inside his chamber. They made love together.

He didn’t see her after conversation with Bran and Sam. He escaped from his lovers every time. He knows how it hurts Dany but Jon was confuse.

Jon left this room and walked outside. He looked at Dany. He ws standing middle of the Winterfell and spoke with Arya. Jon was surprise. Ghost was there too. Jon missed his wolf but he followed to Dany everywhere.

- what are you doing here?_ Jon heard the voice. It was Bran.

- nothing.

-you’re looking them?

- no just,…

- Arya likes queen. She is very close with her. More close than with her own sister.

Jon turned around. Arya was talking and Dany smiled. Bran was right. He never seen his sister like that. Especially with Sansa.

- she is beautiful.- tells Bran - she was beautiful and innocent when merried with Khal Drogo. She was amazing when her dragons born.

- did you see?

- I saw that night when she was born in Dragonstone. It was terrible night. _Bran stopped and looked at him- you are her fate. Aegon Targaryen was her fate.

- don’t speak about that.

- it’s right. Targaryens married brother and sister during centuries. Age was always important. Dany was equal of your brother Aegon -Jon deep breaths. It was strange feelings. His brother was always Rickon, Robb and Bran. But his blood was only Aegon and Rhaenys-Daenerys is your fate. You can run from her but your roads are connecting with Queen.

-it’s… I can’t. I am a Stark. Ned Stark grow me up and …

- and Ned Stark’s parents were cousins.

Jon looked at Dany. She was talking with Arya again. Queen made eye contact with him. Arya stopped and found her eyes. It was Jon. Arya smiled and tried to tell something but she found unbelievable sadness inside queen’s eyes.

-can we go? -asked Dany.

-where your grace?

-you can choice a place. Can you ridding horse?

-of course.

-good. Just take your horse.

Dany took her horse so quickly and left Winterfell. Arya followed her.

-where are you going Daenerys?- Dany didn’t like whenArya called “your grace”

-we can find Nymeria.

-she doesn’t want to follow me. Nymeria is wilding now.

-animals can’t leave their masters to easily. Drogon left me one time but she came back to me and saved me from killers. Probably Nymeria is angry to you but she knows who you are.

-Dragons can’t leave their riders. Dragons are like humans. Sometimes they angry with us and just fly away.

-you think that Nymeria wants me again?

-I am sure. Just trust me.

Arya smiled and followed to her.

-My Brother…

-please Arya don’t…

- he loves you. _Dany stopped her horse. She felt tears on the check _ he is confuse. He lost himself. He needs a time but I know… no, I don’t know. I am absolutely sure that he loves you more than everyone and everything. I know him much better than others. I know what he feels now.

- and what he feels now Arya?

- Love and confuse. He is fighting with himself. I found his feelings When you arrived in Winterfell with Jon. It’s difficult to admit but Sansa was right about Jon.

- what about?

- about you both!

- she thought that we were together?

- she was Sure. I accepted it when I saw how he cared to you. How he looked at you. He was worrying about you. Jon told me that you had never experience with cold climate.

- I am worrying about him too. He is alone now. He is confuse and lost and I cannot help. _ he could not stop tears- he is my last relative, my last family, my last hope. I can’t lose him Arya. I need to speak with him but I am afraid. I am afraid about his reaction.

- damn, you truly loves him.

- and I will always love him. Until my last day. - Dany closed her eyes .- we need to go and find your Wolf Arya.

Jon turned around. Arya was talking and Dany smiled. Bran was right. He never seen his sister like that. Especially with Sansa.

-it’s… I can’t. I am a Stark. Ned Stark grow me up and …

- and Ned Stark’s parents were cousins.

Jon looked at Dany. She was talking with Arya again. Queen made eye contact with him. Arya stopped and found her eyes. It was Jon. Arya smiled and tried to tell something but she found unbelievable sadness inside queen’s eyes.

-can we go? -asked Dany.

-where your grace?

-you can choice a place. Can you ridding horse?

-of course.

-good. Just take your horse.

Dany took her horse so quickly and left Winterfell. Arya followed her.

-she doesn’t want to follow me. Nymeria is wilding now.

-please Arya don’t…

- and what he feels now Arya?

- about you both!

- she thought that we were together?

- she was Sure. I accepted it when I saw how he cared to you. How he looked at you. He was worrying about you. Jon told me that you had never experience with cold climate.

- I am worrying about him too. He is alone now. He is confuse and lost and I cannot help. _ he could not stop tears- he is my last relative, my last family, my last hope. I can’t lose him Arya. I need to speak with him but I am afraid. I am afraid about his reaction.

- damn, you truly loves him.

- and I will always love him. Until my last day. - Dany closed her eyes .- we need to go and find your Wolf Arya.

Sometimes I like to look back and see where our favourite kids came from. They've all grown so much!
Season 8 will be end of an...
body:
Sometimes I like to look back and see where our favourite kids came from. They’ve all grown so much!

Season 8 will be end of an awesome journey for them. So excited. It’ll be great!

blog.name: wolfqueen-is-here
blog.title: I'm not a Stark. | You are to me.
blog.description: Former: jonsacravings. She/her, bi. Posting: GoT, Jonsa, Sansa Stark, House Stark | Also loves: musical theatre, travelling, B99, Downton Abbey, Dragon Age II & more | Introverted but friendly.

summary: Missing season 7 dialogue
title: Missing season 7 dialogue
body:
Not that I’m not a great fan of Brienne and the Hound planning to adopt Arya together–I loved that scene, cheap as I am.

But the absolute lack of interaction between Jon and Brienne… That’s just bad writing, my dudes.

I mean can you even imagine Jon not cornering Brienne like: “If you’re here, who’s with Sansa? Who’s keeping her safe? Please don’t tell me you left her alone with Littlefinger because I swear to gods…”

And then Brienne going: “Keep it in your pants Don’t you worry, Your Grace. Her sister is with her.”

Which wouldn’t really reassure him, since: “And who’s taking care of Arya?”

I need Brienne smiling as she did with the Hound.

“Arya. Arya is taking care of Arya. Arya is keeping Sansa safe. You have nothing to worry about, both of your cousins oh wait that’s a spoiler half-sisters are protected by Needle.”

Pride and love in Jon’s eyes, I’d give anything to see that. I hope all the talking about Sansa in season 7 with eeeeevery single character was a setup for Jonsa ‘cause otherwise I don’t get why he wouldn’t mention Arya more than that one time when he went sorta like “Oh, and my other sister is home, too. Whatevs, I guess.”

reblog.comment:
Not that I’m not a great fan of Brienne and the Hound planning to adopt Arya together–I loved that scene, cheap as I am.

But the absolute lack of interaction between Jon and Brienne… That’s just bad writing, my dudes.

I mean can you even imagine Jon not cornering Brienne like: “If you’re here, who’s with Sansa? Who’s keeping her safe? Please don’t tell me you left her alone with Littlefinger because I swear to gods…”

And then Brienne going: “Keep it in your pants Don’t you worry, Your Grace. Her sister is with her.”

Which wouldn’t really reassure him, since: “And who’s taking care of Arya?”

I need Brienne smiling as she did with the Hound.

“Arya. Arya is taking care of Arya. Arya is keeping Sansa safe. You have nothing to worry about, both of your cousins oh wait that’s a spoiler half-sisters are protected by Needle.”

Pride and love in Jon’s eyes, I’d give anything to see that. I hope all the talking about Sansa in season 7 with eeeeevery single character was a setup for Jonsa ‘cause otherwise I don’t get why he wouldn’t mention Arya more than that one time when he went sorta like “Oh, and my other sister is home, too. Whatevs, I guess.”

trail.content_raw:
Not that I’m not a great fan of Brienne and the Hound planning to adopt Arya together–I loved that scene, cheap as I am.

But the absolute lack of interaction between Jon and Brienne… That’s just bad writing, my dudes.

I mean can you even imagine Jon not cornering Brienne like: “If you’re here, who’s with Sansa? Who’s keeping her safe? Please don’t tell me you left her alone with Littlefinger because I swear to gods…”

And then Brienne going: “Keep it in your pants Don’t you worry, Your Grace. Her sister is with her.”

Which wouldn’t really reassure him, since: “And who’s taking care of Arya?”

I need Brienne smiling as she did with the Hound.

“Arya. Arya is taking care of Arya. Arya is keeping Sansa safe. You have nothing to worry about, both of your cousins oh wait that’s a spoiler half-sisters are protected by Needle.”

Pride and love in Jon’s eyes, I’d give anything to see that. I hope all the talking about Sansa in season 7 with eeeeevery single character was a setup for Jonsa ‘cause otherwise I don’t get why he wouldn’t mention Arya more than that one time when he went sorta like “Oh, and my other sister is home, too. Whatevs, I guess.”
trail.content:
Not that I’m not a great fan of Brienne and the Hound planning to adopt Arya together–I loved that scene, cheap as I am.

But the absolute lack of interaction between Jon and Brienne… That’s just bad writing, my dudes.

I mean can you even imagine Jon not cornering Brienne like: “If you’re here, who’s with Sansa? Who’s keeping her safe? Please don’t tell me you left her alone with Littlefinger because I swear to gods…”

And then Brienne going: “Keep it in your pants Don’t you worry, Your Grace. Her sister is with her.”

Which wouldn’t really reassure him, since: “And who’s taking care of Arya?”

I need Brienne smiling as she did with the Hound.

“Arya. Arya is taking care of Arya. Arya is keeping Sansa safe. You have nothing to worry about, both of your cousins oh wait that’s a spoiler half-sisters are protected by Needle.”

Pride and love in Jon’s eyes, I’d give anything to see that. I hope all the talking about Sansa in season 7 with eeeeevery single character was a setup for Jonsa ‘cause otherwise I don’t get why he wouldn’t mention Arya more than that one time when he went sorta like “Oh, and my other sister is home, too. Whatevs, I guess.”

blog.name: ladystarks
blog.title: lo, the transforming power of love

summary: things you said on the phone at 4 am jon/daenerys
question: things you said on the phone at 4 am jon/daenerys
answer:
27) things you said on the phone at 4 am

“Do you still miss me?” Dany asks him, slurring her words. “Because I miss you all the time.”

“You’re drunk, Daenerys,” Jon tells her, rubbing his eyes. 

“Of course I am,” she says, hiccuping. “I wanted to talk to you and I was scared, so I needed a drink. But I miss you.”

“You broke up with me,” Jon reminds her, sitting up in bed. “And now you’re the one calling me at four in the morning.” 

“I made a mistake,” she says, “and I think we should try again. Where are you, Jon? I miss you.”

Jon misses her too, though he can’t say it when she’s drunk. Finally, he sighs, and makes his decision. “Where are you? I’ll pick you up.”

blog.name: julibf
blog.title: A Song of Ice and Fire

summary: BOOK CHAPTERS FORESHADOWING... PART 2
title: BOOK CHAPTERS FORESHADOWING... PART 2
body:
So, remember my bizarre theory that George RRMartin uses the order of the chapters of the books to foreshadow or tell the reader a few secrets of the story?? You can read more here if you want to.  I decided to keep on looking on others chapters to see if I could find more interesting finds…

The first person who notice George using the order of the chapters to foreshadow an event was our own lovely @nattyslove22 who posted this image of Sansa chapter in the Vale shere she laments that no one will ever marry her for love.

 

This picture was a huge hint that Jon and Sansa may indeed marry for love. So, if George put those two chapters following each other, what are the chances he made the same for other chapters???

I then decided to go look for more Jonsas evidences in the books, paying attention to the following chapters after Sansa’s marriage discussions and for my surprise I realize that almost everytime Sansa possible marriages are being discussed, the following chapter is always JON.

 _______________________________________________________________


  • JON SNOW AND SANSA STARK MARRIAGE FORESHADOWING

In the first book A GAME OF THRONES, chapter 4 Eddard I, we have King Robert arriving at Winterfell and asking to visit Lyanna tomb in the crypts of the castle. While there King Robert decides to ask for Sansa’s hand in marriage for his son prince Joffrey. This is the chapter where Sansa and Joffrey become officially betrothed to each other and their Royal engagement its made official. The very next chapter? JON!!!!. This is also the chapter where Jon Snow will get drunk in the Feats for the king and ask uncle Ben to join the NightsWatch.

 

In a CLASH OF KINGS chapter 52, SANSA IV, Sansa will get her period and be finally “fit to bear children to the king”. She is taken to the royal chambers to have breakfast with Cersei and discuss her future marriage to Joffrey. Cersei tries, as best as she can, to be a mother figure to Sansa in this very special moment and gives her a womanly advice. She tells her that love is a dangerous feeling that makes us all weaker and it should wiser for her to love only her children. Once again we have a chapter discussing Sansa future marriage to a king and the following chapter is JON VII.


Finally on A STORM OF SWORDS, we have the famous chapter 68, Sansa VI, where she is discussing with her aunt Lysa, the idea to marry her cousin, little Robbin. Sansa then laments that no one will ever marry her for love, and believes that its only her name and Winterfell that they all want. The next chapter once again? JON IX


Do you see why I have very little doubt Jon and Sansa will marry for love? That much foreshadow its not a coincidence.


________________________________________________________________

  • SANSA AND YGRITTE CONNECTION

 

In A CLASH OF KINGS, chapter 51, we will have Jon Snow meeting Ygritte for the first time. By the end of the chapter Jon is ordered to execute Ygritte, yet, he fails to do IT. He lets her go and we all believed it was because she was a girl, but the following chapter its SANSA IV, which may be a clue form George that the reason Jon could not kill Ygritte, its because it reminded him too much of his red hair half sister.

 

 BTW what I am gathering from the books, it’s the idea that Sansa its always dreaming of love, always hoping for love, like she almost believed no one ever loved her. Sometimes I get the feeling she even doubts her own family love for her. The fact she always trying to please her parents like a puppy, or the way she resents Arya friendship with the common people and the fact she rather spent time with them; the fact that Robb left her in Kings Landing and never tried to exchange her life for Jaime Lannister.

The more I read about her I get a feeling that she was always a good girl, trying to please people because she desperately wanted them to love her, yet never really believe they did.

But I am also getting the idea that Jon always loved her, since day one from book 1. And this idea makes more and more sense. To have Sansa traveling the entire kingdom looking for love, while he was there all this time, right in Winterfell, its something very George RRMartin. 

 _______________________________________________________________


  • TYRION  AND DAENERYS

 

In A CLASH OF KINGS, chapter 48 DAENERYS IV. We have Daenerys entering the House of the Undying where Daenerys will see visions of the future and past. Is in this chapter that Daenerys hears one of the most famous prophecies of the books. In this prophecy, the voices in the House of Undying tell Daenerys that “three fires must you light: one for life and one for death and one to love…” The next chapter of the book is chapter 49, TYRION XI. This will be the chapter where Tyrion will discover 13,000 jars of wildfire hidden underneath the city of Kings Landing. So, yeahh, I am expecting the third fire that Daenerys will light up to be Kings Landing.

 _______________________________________________________________


  • JAIME LANNISTER’S CHOICES

 

In the first book A GAME OF THRONES, in the chapter 9, TYRION II, is followed by JON II. And look what we have here. This is where we have the famous conversation of the Lannisters siblings about Bran, where Tyrion informs Jaime and Cersei that the boy may live and it will be interesting to hear what he has to say once he wakes up. Jaime and Cersei look concerned and Jaime wonders who side Tyrion really is, to which Tyrion reaffirms his love and loyalty for his family. The next chapter is JON!!!


Then later in A STORM OF SWORDS, chapter 72 Jaime IX chapter its also followed by JON X. In this chapter Jaime Lannister is contemplating his life achievements and how little has been written about him in the White Book of the Kingsguard. He is finally realizing that there is not much time left for him to do something great of his life and the rest of his history he will have to write himself and he is finally free to do whatever he chooses!!!

We will see the Lannisters having to decide what side of the war they will choose, Daenerys or Jon and the books seems to point out they will choose JON.

 _______________________________________________________________


  • JON AND DAENERYS

Finally in A DANCE OF DRAGONS, chapter 52 - Daenerys IX, we have the chapter where Daenerys finally rides Drogon for the first time. Now, if you pay attention to the final lines of this chapter, the way Daenerys describes her riding experience on top of Drogon, it reads very much as a sexual experience. It almost sounds like a sex act. The next chapter of the book is JON IX and again, I don’t think it’s a coincidence. I believe this is a foreshadowing of the love affair, an affair that will be based on physical attraction and lust. We saw it on season 7, the beginning of this affair but I don’t think its going to be long lived.

BTW, the tv show also uses this method to foreshadow future events. Thats how I figured out Daenerys will be the Queen of Ashes by paying attention to the tv show foreshadowing.


That’s also how @mebongster87 was able to catch the hint that Jon will be a Stark by the end of this story in one their metas. (This is now one of my favorite theories!!!)

 

So, that’s it for now. I was wishing I could read the entire A GAME OF THRONES in December to find out more hints and clues, but there is no way my ADHD can allowed me to read the entire book in one month. So, if anyone of you wanna try to look for more clues, please feel free to post online. I don’t consider this to be my own theory since it was @nattyslove22 the first on to notice this. The more foreshadows we may find the better. I just want to figure out the ending of this tale.

This is also the chapter where Jon Snow will get drunk in the Feats for the king and ask uncle Ben to join the NightsWatch.

 

In a CLASH OF KINGS chapter 52, SANSA IV, Sansa will get her period and be finally “fit to bear children to the king”. She is taken to the royal chambers to have breakfast with Cersei and discuss her future marriage to Joffrey. Cersei tries, as best as she can, to be a mother figure to Sansa in this very special moment and gives her a womanly advice. She tells her that love is a dangerous feeling that makes us all weaker and it should wiser for her to love only her children. Once again we have a chapter discussing Sansa future marriage to a king and the following chapter is JON VII.


Finally on A STORM OF SWORDS, we have the famous chapter 68, Sansa VI, where she is discussing with her aunt Lysa, the idea to marry her cousin, little Robbin. Sansa then laments that no one will ever marry her for love, and believes that its only her name and Winterfell that they all want. The next chapter once again? JON IX


Do you see why I have very little doubt Jon and Sansa will marry for love? That much foreshadow its not a coincidence.


________________________________________________________________

  • SANSA AND YGRITTE CONNECTION

 

In A CLASH OF KINGS, chapter 51, we will have Jon Snow meeting Ygritte for the first time. By the end of the chapter Jon is ordered to execute Ygritte, yet, he fails to do IT. He lets her go and we all believed it was because she was a girl, but the following chapter its SANSA IV, which may be a clue form George that the reason Jon could not kill Ygritte, its because it reminded him too much of his red hair half sister.

 

 BTW what I am gathering from the books, it’s the idea that Sansa its always dreaming of love, always hoping for love, like she almost believed no one ever loved her. Sometimes I get the feeling she even doubts her own family love for her. The fact she always trying to please her parents like a puppy, or the way she resents Arya friendship with the common people and the fact she rather spent time with them; the fact that Robb left her in Kings Landing and never tried to exchange her life for Jaime Lannister.

The more I read about her I get a feeling that she was always a good girl, trying to please people because she desperately wanted them to love her, yet never really believe they did.

But I am also getting the idea that Jon always loved her, since day one from book 1. And this idea makes more and more sense. To have Sansa traveling the entire kingdom looking for love, while he was there all this time, right in Winterfell, its something very George RRMartin. 

 _______________________________________________________________


  • TYRION  AND DAENERYS

 

In A CLASH OF KINGS, chapter 48 DAENERYS IV. We have Daenerys entering the House of the Undying where Daenerys will see visions of the future and past. Is in this chapter that Daenerys hears one of the most famous prophecies of the books. In this prophecy, the voices in the House of Undying tell Daenerys that “three fires must you light: one for life and one for death and one to love…” The next chapter of the book is chapter 49, TYRION XI. This will be the chapter where Tyrion will discover 13,000 jars of wildfire hidden underneath the city of Kings Landing. So, yeahh, I am expecting the third fire that Daenerys will light up to be Kings Landing.

 _______________________________________________________________


  • JAIME LANNISTER’S CHOICES

 

In the first book A GAME OF THRONES, in the chapter 9, TYRION II, is followed by JON II. And look what we have here. This is where we have the famous conversation of the Lannisters siblings about Bran, where Tyrion informs Jaime and Cersei that the boy may live and it will be interesting to hear what he has to say once he wakes up. Jaime and Cersei look concerned and Jaime wonders who side Tyrion really is, to which Tyrion reaffirms his love and loyalty for his family. The next chapter is JON!!!


Then later in A STORM OF SWORDS, chapter 72 Jaime IX chapter its also followed by JON X. In this chapter Jaime Lannister is contemplating his life achievements and how little has been written about him in the White Book of the Kingsguard. He is finally realizing that there is not much time left for him to do something great of his life and the rest of his history he will have to write himself and he is finally free to do whatever he chooses!!!

We will see the Lannisters having to decide what side of the war they will choose, Daenerys or Jon and the books seems to point out they will choose JON.

 _______________________________________________________________


  • JON AND DAENERYS

Finally in A DANCE OF DRAGONS, chapter 52 - Daenerys IX, we have the chapter where Daenerys finally rides Drogon for the first time. Now, if you pay attention to the final lines of this chapter, the way Daenerys describes her riding experience on top of Drogon, it reads very much as a sexual experience. It almost sounds like a sex act. The next chapter of the book is JON IX and again, I don’t think it’s a coincidence. I believe this is a foreshadowing of the love affair, an affair that will be based on physical attraction and lust. We saw it on season 7, the beginning of this affair but I don’t think its going to be long lived.

BTW, the tv show also uses this method to foreshadow future events. Thats how I figured out Daenerys will be the Queen of Ashes by paying attention to the tv show foreshadowing.


That’s also how @mebongster87 was able to catch the hint that Jon will be a Stark by the end of this story in one their metas. (This is now one of my favorite theories!!!)

 

So, that’s it for now. I was wishing I could read the entire A GAME OF THRONES in December to find out more hints and clues, but there is no way my ADHD can allowed me to read the entire book in one month. So, if anyone of you wanna try to look for more clues, please feel free to post online. I don’t consider this to be my own theory since it was @nattyslove22 the first on to notice this. The more foreshadows we may find the better. I just want to figure out the ending of this tale.

blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: Kit is annoyed by being thought of as a beef cake action star
Why couldn't Jon be more complex?  Even the actor would have liked that.
summary: Kit is as annoyed by the show runners “vision” of Jon as you are
title: Kit is as annoyed by the show runners “vision” of Jon as you are
body: How did I miss this article?  Kit Harington remains annoyed by what he is given to work with again.  The fact that he is as annoyed with what he is given to work with as we are is great.  https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/04/entertainment/kit-harington-game-thrones/index.html

blog.name: wallofprompts
blog.title: The Wall of Prompts
blog.description: GoT prompts. Grab a prompt for a fic or left one. Main ships Jonerys and Gendrya, but everyone is welcome. Check the tags list for prompts.

summary: Rhaegar survives beyond the Wall
title: Rhaegar survives beyond the Wall
body:
Rhaegar survives the injuries caused by Robert at the Battle of the Trident. But by the time he is healed, the sack of King’s Landing, the events of the Tower of joy and the assault of Dragonstone had already happened, furthermore, he didn’t hear of Daenerys, so he assumes his mother’s baby died like the others and nobody knows what happened to Viserys.

Devoured by grief and guilt, he thinks there is only one place where he deserves to go: Beyond the Wall.

He crosses the Wall persuing the prophecy he believed in. During his efforts to find threads of the prophecy he ends taken in by a wilding’s clan. He changes his name and takes in some of their customs while consorting with their wood witches, wargs and seers. Everybody knows he is a Southron, but nobody knew who he really is.

By the time the clans united under Mance, Rhaegar tries to avoid him as much as he can so Mance can’t figure it out who he is. Until a young Night’s Watcher is brought to their camp, one who looks too much alike Lyanna.

He changes his name and takes in some of their customs while consorting with their wood witches, wargs and seers. Everybody knows he is a Southron, but nobody knew who he really is.
